messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/api.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostController@destroy` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/v1/posts/{post}`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/api.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostController@destroy`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files containing the handler implementation for App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostController@destroy:

- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php

Explanation:
- routes/api.php registers Route::apiResource('posts', PostController::class) for the API v1 namespace, which resolves to App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostController.
- The destroy method for that controller is implemented in app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostController.php. In that file the destroy(Post $post): Response method authorizes the deletion, calls $post->delete(), and returns response()->noContent().
- Note: there are other PostController classes in the project (app/Http/Controllers/PostController.php and app/Http/Controllers/Admin/PostController.php), but they are in different namespaces and are not the controller referenced by the API v1 route.
